environment.GUI.views

Interface Animated.Visual

  • Enclosing class:
    Animated
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface Animated.Visual
    The interface used to produce the visual representation of the Location.

    This interface is used to allow the Animated.Visualisation to create visual representations of a Location, by using the interface as a FunctionalInterface to use in the Animated.Visualisation.visual; which allows the procedure of drawing a Location to be used in the Animated.Visualisation.

    Since:
    08/04/2017
    Version:
    08/04/2017
    Author:
    John Berg

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void visiulise(java.awt.Graphics g, Location loc, int x, int y)
      Create the visual representation of the Location.

    • Method Detail

      • visiulise

        void visiulise(java.awt.Graphics g,
               Location loc,
               int x,
               int y)
        Create the visual representation of the Location.

        Provide a Graphics and Location object which are the graphics to draw to and the Location to be drawn, along with an int x and y coordinate which specify the target location of where to draw.

        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics add the visual representation to.
        loc - The Location to be visually represented.
        x - The x position of the Animated.Visual.
        y - The y position of the Animated.Visual.
        See Also:
        Graphics, Location
